data.body:
Forgot to upload the test Blender file
[two_tris.zip](https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/files/168048/two_tris.zip)

###### More info

I swapped the Y and Z vert positions in mesh.py:

`vector = (vertex.co.x, vertex.co.z, -vertex.co.y)`

in lines 151, 406 and 759

 and then exported with hierarchies checked on and the result looks as it should:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3812933/13685429/46544262-e6c5-11e5-87e8-490feebc779c.png)

I tried this with a few other blend files with success:
- Two pyramids (from issue #8317)
  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3812933/13685491/9b46a954-e6c5-11e5-8a6c-3b5fbc3c31b3.png)
- Cylinder with 5 bones:
  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3812933/13685588/f874bd8c-e6c5-11e5-8bc3-f205bf74fe40.png)
- the Marine with the IK rig:
  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3812933/13685563/dbf7c60e-e6c5-11e5-81ca-4ef9277a1dd4.png)

However I did get this error when trying to re-export the marine_anims.blend file that comes packaged with the examples in r73:

`
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Program Files\Blender Foundation\Blender\2.76\scripts\addons\io_three\__init__.py", line 787, in execute
    exporter.export_scene(filepath, settings)
  File "C:\Program Files\Blender Foundation\Blender\2.76\scripts\addons\io_three\exporter\__init__.py", line 20, in inner
    func(filepath, options, *args, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Program Files\Blender Foundation\Blender\2.76\scripts\addons\io_three\exporter\__init__.py", line 51, in export_scene
    scene_.parse()
  File "C:\Program Files\Blender Foundation\Blender\2.76\scripts\addons\io_three\exporter\scene.py", line 108, in parse
    self._parse_objects()
  File "C:\Program Files\Blender Foundation\Blender\2.76\scripts\addons\io_three\exporter\scene.py", line 230, in _parse_objects
    obj = object_.Object(node, parent=self[constants.OBJECT])
  File "C:\Program Files\Blender Foundation\Blender\2.76\scripts\addons\io_three\exporter\object.py", line 12, in __init__
    self._node_setup()
  File "C:\Program Files\Blender Foundation\Blender\2.76\scripts\addons\io_three\exporter\object.py", line 133, in _node_setup
    tracks = api.object.animated_xform(self.node, self.options)
  File "C:\Program Files\Blender Foundation\Blender\2.76\scripts\addons\io_three\exporter\api\object.py", line 53, in inner
    return func(obj, *args, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Program Files\Blender Foundation\Blender\2.76\scripts\addons\io_three\exporter\api\object.py", line 233, in animated_xform
    for time in times:
TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable
`

I've tracked it down to the action 'Tpose.' I know there's an error with the action itself but I'm not sure what it is exactly. I removed it and created a new one from which to grab the bind pose and I 
[marine_anims with new action for grabbinbg bind pose.zip]
got it to export. However, this is the result. 

I had to zoom out a lot to see the bone visualization:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3812933/13685835/76f4a4a0-e6c7-11e5-8441-6fc9726d12cd.png)

Then I noticed the marine was scaled up by a factor of 100 so I applied the transformation (baked the the scale) and re-exported and I got this:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3812933/13685946/0a5126ba-e6c8-11e5-9a63-41f0cc513496.png)

It looks fine, but the model was really large now, so I had to zoom out quite a bit to see it.

Here's an updated marine_anims.blend file, the exported JSON and the mesh.py file with my changes.
(https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/files/168066/marine_anims.with.new.action.for.grabbinbg.bind.pose.zip)

I'd like to make a pull request so I can look more into this issue. 

...

The JSON Blender exporter has been removed with `R93` (#14117). 

Also see: https://threejs.org/docs/#manual/introduction/Loading-3D-models
